summary: This bill, the Ocmulgee Mounds National Park and Preserve Establishment Act, designates the Ocmulgee Mounds National Historical Park as the Ocmulgee Mounds National Park and establishes the Ocmulgee Mounds National Preserve in Georgia. It outlines land acquisition processes (with no eminent domain), administration, and management, including hunting and fishing regulations. It mandates a management plan and establishes an advisory council. The bill also places approximately 126 acres of land owned by the Muscogee (Creek) Nation into trust and authorizes appropriations for its implementation.
